title: Twitter Personality Charged With 2016 Election Interference
summary: Federal prosecutors say Douglass Mackey, tweeting as Ricky Vaughn, tried to trick people into casting ineligible votes for Democrat Hillary Clinton. Federal prosecutors charged a Florida man with interfering in the 2016 presidential election, saying he conspired to share misinformation on widely followed Twitter accounts in an effort to trick people into not casting legal votes. Justice Department officials said the charge may be the first of its kind.

title: DHS Issues National Terrorism Bulletin for Domestic Extremists
summary: Advisory warns that Jan. 6 riot at Capitol could motivate extremists to attack in coming weeks. The Department of Homeland Security issued its first-ever national terrorism bulletin about violent domestic extremists, warning they could attack in the coming weeks, emboldened by the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol.

title: GameStop Mania Reveals Power Shift on Wall Street-and the Pros Are Reeling
summary: Resume Subscription. The power dynamics are shifting on Wall Street. Individual investors are winning big-at least for now-and relishing it.

title: The Two-Track Jobs Recovery
summary: Job losses in 2020 were far higher in states that loved lockdowns.. Recall the political panic after the Labor Department reported 140,000 job losses in December? Well, the government's state employment report released Tuesday shows those losses were largely related to state lockdowns, and jobs are rebounding rapidly in less restrictive states.

title: Biden Defunds the States
summary: His oil and gas drilling moratorium is an assault on school funding.. President Biden wants to give states $130 billion more in Covid relief, but he may need more after Wednesday. The oil and gas lease moratorium on federal lands that he announced will erase thousands of blue-collar jobs-and billions of dollars in revenue that states use to fund education.

title: Apple's Blockbuster Results Play to a Tough Crowd
summary: Record-breaking quarter comes as stock has already reached a record high valuation. $100 billion should feel better than this.

title: Schumer and His Shadow
summary: The Senate leader echoes AOC in calling for a climate 'emergency.'. Chuck Schumer has finally achieved his long-time dream of becoming Senate Majority Leader. Pity, then, that he is acting as if he lives in mortal political fear of Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

title: Cloris Leachman, Oscar- and Emmy-Winner, Has Died at 94
summary: A character actor of extraordinary range, Leachman defied typecasting. Cloris Leachman, an Oscar-winner for her portrayal of a lonely housewife in "The Last Picture Show" and a comedic delight as the fearsome Frau Blücher in "Young Frankenstein" and neighbor Phyllis on "The Mary Tyler Moore Show," has died. She was 94.

title: Some Senators Push Censure as Alternative to Trump Trial
summary: Amid little GOP support for a conviction, Collins and Kaine seek support for formal condemnation of former president's actions. WASHINGTON -- Two senators from opposite sides of the aisle were working Wednesday to build support for censuring former President Donald Trump over his rhetoric ahead of the Capitol riot as an alternative to proceeding to an impeachment trial likely to result in his acquittal.

title: Biden's First Week Was a Race to the Left
summary: The new president's actions don't suggest he's interested in bipartisan progress.. If America were diabetic, it would be suffering from hyperglycemia after the sugary coverage of President Biden's first week.

title: New York Times Taps Editor to Oversee Audio Unit After 'Caliphate' Controversy
summary: Cliff Levy is promoted to deputy managing editor, will develop procedures for vetting audio content in interim role. The New York Times said it assigned a top editor to develop procedures to vet stories from its audio unit, a part of the business that is growing quickly but has drawn criticism recently over its "Caliphate" series.

title: The Big Tech Crackdown Is a Gift to Parler
summary: The losses from finding new servers will be dwarfed by the gains from all the free publicity.. The coordinated actions of Big Tech against Parler, a free-speech competitor to Twitter , have attracted much attention and debate. Some argue that deplatforming Parler was necessary to stop further violence after the riot at the Capitol on Jan. 6. Others see political discrimination at work, given that Facebook , YouTube and Twitter also host bad actors. Everyone seems to agree that the actions by Big Tech caused great harm to Parler.

title: If You Watch TV, the Signs Are Everywhere
summary: It all adds up as Paramount+ joins Disney+, Apple TV+, ESPN+ and others.. Nothing is "new and improved" anymore. It's all about the plus.

title: Notable & Quotable: A Program for Deprogramming After Trump
summary: 'The number of Americans who need to be deprogrammed is in the 'millions.''. From a Jan. 26 New York Sun editorial:

title: Joe Biden's Rule of Law Problem
summary: Without resistance, the U.S. is tipping toward the mob style in politics-on the left and right.. The Capitol occupation and riot of Jan. 6 will haunt American political life for years. Condemnation of the invasion of the Capitol is virtually universal, as is support for prosecuting those arrested inside.

title: 'Earth's Wild Music' Review: Listening for Nature's Melody
summary: In the face of extinctions, a writer's call to cherish the voices that make a symphony out of the natural world.. For half a century, philosopher Kathleen Dean Moore has written about the natural world, her work shaped by the homes she's made in Corvallis, Ore., and Chichaghof Island, Alaska. It's also indebted to the conservationist and writer Rachel Carson (1907-1964), best known for "Silent Spring," the landmark 1962 book in which she envisioned a world eerily hushed by pesticides. "I imagine," Ms. Moore writes of Carson, "she called the book 'Silent Spring' . . . because it was the loss of the birds' music that would grieve her the most."

title: Fed Holds Policy Steady as Economy Stumbles
summary: 'The pandemic still provides considerable downside risks,' Fed Chairman Powell says. The Federal Reserve kept its easy money policies in place, saying that business activity has softened with the resurgence of Covid-19 cases, but hoping the rollout of vaccines will tame the pandemic and heal the economy.

title: Stocks Drop on Concerns About Vaccine Rollout
summary: Fed leaves monetary policy unchanged. Major stock indexes suffered their sharpest one-day losses since October on Wednesday amid concerns about Covid-19 vaccine distribution, while traders were also captivated by the frenzied trading in GameStop and other heavily shorted stocks.

title: Outages Continue to Plague Online Brokerages
summary: Schwab, Vanguard, Fidelity and others reported new service disruptions. Outages and interruptions rattled investors using some of the largest online brokers on Wednesday.

title: Shape-Shifting Virus Threatens Cycles of Illness, Lockdowns
summary: Spread of more-transmissible and potentially deadlier variants of Covid-19 could slow economic recovery. The biggest shock to the global economy in a century is mutating-literally.

title: Bronx Man Charged in Shooting of NYPD Officer
summary: Suspect faces attempted murder, other charges; officer in stable condition. A Bronx man was charged with attempted murder Wednesday for allegedly shooting a New York City police officer assigned to a unit that investigates illegal gun trafficking, police officials said.

title: Fed Needs a Poker Face to Avoid Taper Tell
summary: Federal Reserve faces a challenge in how it will eventually communicate an exit strategy with the market. The first rule of tapering is don't talk about tapering anytime soon.

title: GameStop Is a Bubble in Its Purest Form
summary: It is tempting to see GameStop's soaring stock as merely the result of clownish behavior in a chat room. That would be a mistake.. GameStop is the platonic ideal of a stock bubble.

title: Ousted Saudi Spymaster Is Accused of Embezzling Billions
summary: Lawsuit filed in Canada by Saudi state-owned companies targets a longtime ally of the kingdom's former crown prince. State-owned companies of Saudi Arabia have sued the country's former spymaster in a Canadian court, alleging he embezzled billions of dollars, in a case that throws a spotlight on a bitter royal feud.

title: 'The Met Unframed' Review: Phoning It In
summary: The Metropolitan Museum of Art's digital show feels more like an ad for a telecom company than a virtual exhibition.. For all the strife the arts have endured during the Covid-19 pandemic, there has been at least one welcome side effect. From encyclopedic institutions to jewel-box museums and small galleries, cultural standard bearers have experimented with new ventures that bring art into our lives in ways that both democratize the process-no more having to save for a ticket to Rome to see the Vatican Museums-and upend the traditional viewer-in-a-white-cube experience. Enter "The Met Unframed" (through Feb. 16), from New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Biden Makes New Push to Address Climate Change
summary: Executive orders aim to suspend new oil and gas leases on federal land, commit government to conservation and other initiatives. WASHINGTON-President Biden took a series of steps to address climate change Wednesday, suspending new oil and gas leases on federal land and confronting the issue through diplomatic, conservation and other initiatives.

title: Indoor Dining in New York City Could Be Back on the Table
summary: Gov. Cuomo says decision expected by end of week. Indoor dining at restaurants in New York City, which has been suspended since early December to help limit the spread of Covid-19, may reopen soon.

title: Renewed Demand for Treasurys Quells Fears of Rising Rates-for Now
summary: Yields have stabilized after surging on Democratic Senate wins, but sharp increase has alerted investors to threat higher yields pose to riskier assets. A sharp climb in U.S. government bond yields has stalled, easing investors' concerns that rising rates could undercut recent gains in riskier assets.

Her husband and business partner, Edo Nalic, came to the city as a refugee in his teens. Early in their courtship, this recipe became a touchstone.

title: EU Clashes With AstraZeneca Over Covid-19 Vaccine Shortfall
summary: Bloc says drugmaker must supply vaccine from U.K. factories to meet agreed-upon deliveries, if needed. BRUSSELS-The European Union demanded that AstraZeneca PLC stick to a previously agreed schedule for delivering doses of its Covid-19 vaccine to the 27-nation bloc and, if necessary, supply the vaccine from factories in the U.K.

summary: Dozens of names will disappear from San Francisco school buildings.. After a lengthy but not rigorous review, the intellectual wasteland that is public administration in San Francisco will begin a mass erasure of historical figures.

title: Biden's Order to Freeze New Oil Drilling on Federal Land: What You Need to Know
summary: The administration is halting new drilling permits on U.S. lands as it seeks to fight climate change. Here's how that affects American production.. President Biden has long signaled his intention to curb oil-and-gas drilling on federal land as part of a sweeping effort to reduce U.S. emissions to combat climate change.

title: When Biological Boys Compete With Girls
summary: Perhaps no issue encapsulates the hypocrisy of the far-left agenda than putting the needs of the few-transgender girls-above those of the many-biological girls.. I applaud Abigail Shrier in her advocacy of girls, especially when it comes to the thorny issue of transgender girls' participation in sports ("Joe Biden's First Day Began the End of Girls' Sports," op-ed, Jan. 23). Perhaps no issue encapsulates the hypocrisy of the far-left agenda than putting the needs of the few-transgender girls-above those of the many-biological girls. I am hopeful that female athletes will unite in opposition to President Biden's recent executive order and that prominent female athletes will express their discontent. As Ms. Shrier eloquently writes, so much is at stake for the next generation of girls. As the father of a first-grade daughter, this issue is resonant for me.

title: 'Artlessly Falling' by Code Girl Review: Crooning Couplets
summary: Guitarist Mary Halvorson branches out from her hallmark improvisation on an album that melds her poems and musical compositions..

title: Unity and Killing the Keystone XL Pipeline
summary: Canadians have known for decades that in dealing with America, the rules may change midgame or that Americans may disregard the rules entirely if it suits them.. Regarding your editorial "Biden's Keystone Pipeline Kill" (Jan. 21): Spare us the concern for Canada's feelings. Canadians, and particularly those of us from Alberta, have known for years that Keystone was at risk. Significant changes in energy markets, environmental and climate outlook, and political will over the 15 years since Keystone was proposed have painted an increasingly bleak picture for the project. These forces are at play world-wide, including in Canada, where we can't get a pipeline built across British Columbia for the same reasons. So as disappointing as the Keystone cancellation may be to many, it is hardly a surprise or an insult.

title: There Were Steam Engines Before Wireless Chargers
summary: Civil engineers working for the railroads came up with under-way (without stopping) water replacement.. Regarding "Wireless Charging Fuels Electric-Car Hopes" (Business & Finance, Jan. 19): A similar problem faced the railroad industry in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: Biden Takes Hands-Off Approach to Trump Impeachment
summary: New president has barely weighed in on trial of his predecessor, though it could hamper his agenda. WASHINGTON-President Biden is trying to avoid getting drawn into the approaching Senate impeachment trial as he balances Democratic calls to punish his predecessor with his desire to move forward with his ambitious agenda.

title: What to Watch: Denzel Washington on HBO Max; Ralph Fiennes on Netflix
summary: This week streamers offer the psychological thriller 'The Little Things' and the historical drama 'The Dig.' Plus, Spotify leans into big talent to voice classic books.. This week alone there are projects with Denzel Washington and Jared Leto ("The Little Things") and Ralph Fiennes and Carey Mulligan ("The Dig"). Spotify is also leaning on notable actors to voice audiobooks like Forest Whitaker, Hilary Swank and Cynthia Erivo.

title: Man Pleads Guilty to Plotting to Kidnap Michigan Governor
summary: Defendant is one of six charged in alleged scheme FBI says it foiled last year among domestic extremists targeting Democratic official. One of six men charged in an alleged plot to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer pleaded guilty Wednesday to conspiracy, admitting that the group discussed a scheme to snatch her at her lakeside vacation home and destroy a bridge to slow down police.

title: How Economics Lost Itself in Data
summary: Today's researchers have tossed out price theory and don't realize they've been politically compromised.. William Allen, a professor emeritus of economics at the University of California, Los Angeles died Jan. 15 at 96. Few noted it, but Allen's death was momentous. It represented a generational shift in the economics profession, one that bodes ill for economists and the public. Allen truly believed in economics-something that is hard to say about most economists these days.

The State Department found that the atrocities have expanded to shocking reproductive coercion: "PRC authorities have conducted forced sterilizations and abortions on Uyghur women, coerced them to marry non-Uyghurs, and separated Uyghur children from their families."

title: WHO Recommends Against Moderna, Pfizer Vaccines for Most Pregnant Women
summary: Neither Moderna nor Pfizer enrolled pregnant women in their Covid-19 vaccine trials, and both say they plan future study. The World Health Organization released new guidance about Moderna Inc.'s Covid-19 vaccine this week, recommending generally against the use of the vaccine during pregnancy except in those at high risk of exposure or having a severe case.

title: Boeing Reports Record Annual Loss
summary: Aerospace giant has been hobbled by collapse in plane deliveries, with new 777X delayed until 2023. Boeing Co. reported its largest-ever annual loss and took a big financial hit on its newest jetliner, signs that the Covid-19 pandemic is compounding the aerospace giant's problems.

title: GM to Run a Corporate Super Bowl Ad Touting Electric Vehicles
summary: A new electric vehicle from Cadillac also gets a spot on the game's ad roster. General Motors Co. typically pays millions of dollars to promote individual car brands in the Super Bowl.

title: Here's How Saved Stimulus Checks Could Help Boost the Economy
summary: Affluent Americans are saving more money and may be eager to spend it as businesses reopen. Thanks to federal stimulus checks designed to provide relief to households impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic, some Americans are stowing away more cash than they normally would. Americans saved about twice as much-$1.4 trillion-in the first three quarters of 2020 as they did in the same period of 2019, according to analysis by Berenberg Economics. This phenomenon is expected to spur the economic recovery in the U.S.

title: Fourteen Years and a Demolition Later, Greg Norman Lists Jupiter Island Home for $59.9 Million
summary: After years of trying to sell the Florida property, the golf legend bulldozed the original home and built a 32,000-square-foot compound in its place. Over a period of 14 years, golf legend Greg Norman has listed his Jupiter Island, Fla., home, reduced the price of his home, demolished his home and then replaced it with a large family compound filled with every bell and whistle he could think of.

title: Greg Norman's Jupiter Island Hideaway
summary: The compound includes a glass-enclosed bar area where the golfer and his wife Kiki Norman spent time during the lockdowns. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Exxon Plans Board Changes Amid Activist Pressure
summary: D.E. Shaw Group, Engine No. 1 LLC are the activist investors involved. Exxon Mobil Corp . is preparing to make changes to its board and adopt further measures to reduce its carbon footprint as the beleaguered energy giant faces pressure from a pair of activist investors.

title: Trade Your Sweatshirt for This High-Fashion Trick
summary: How cocooning-or wrapping up in swathes of fabulous fabric-can kelp you kick the Covid blues. WHO NEEDS a hug? If you've been missing physical contact while social distancing these past months, you're not alone-even if you technically are. I'm among the estimated 28% of Americans who live solo, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, but surely I'm not the only one who's been quarantining in a single-bedroom apartment with two only moderately affectionate pets (rabbits, in my case) and a coldly efficient Peloton.

title: Olympic Official Seeks Biden's Help to Save Tokyo Games
summary: Organizers hope a positive message from the U.S. will influence a skeptical Japanese public and reassure countries that aren't sure about sending athletes. TOKYO-The organizers of this year's Summer Olympics, scheduled to start July 23 in Tokyo, have pushed back hard on recent speculation that the Games will have to be scrapped because of the pandemic. There is one more person they'd like on the team to press the message: President Biden.

title: Boeing Isn't Done Stalling Just Yet
summary: Quality issues with the 787 and the delay of the 777X until 2023 highlight all the fixes the plane maker needs to make. Even with the 737 MAX crisis mostly out of the way, Boeing might struggle to gain altitude.

title: How to Use Your 2020 Tax Return to Claim Stimulus Payments
summary: People who didn't get the full relief payments can get the remainder on their 2020 tax returns-if they qualify. WASHINGTON-The Internal Revenue Service is basically done sending out stimulus checks, after finishing a first round in the spring and summer and a second round in December and January. But there are still billions of dollars that some households can claim-through their 2020 tax returns.

title: JPMorgan to Launch U.K. Digital Consumer Bank
summary: New unit will offer services via a mobile app, marking the lender's first entry into the British retail-banking market. JPMorgan Chase & Co., the largest U.S. lender, is launching a digital bank to offer consumer banking services in the U.K. for the first time.

summary: All eight Ivy League schools are in the top 15 nationwide.. Harvard University is the top-ranked Ivy League school in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings for 2021, followed by Yale University and Brown University.

title: Durable-Goods Demand Eased in December
summary: Orders for long-lasting products rose for eighth straight month in U.S., though the 0.2% rise was the smallest since the summer. WASHINGTON-Growth in demand for long-lasting manufactured goods slowed in December, as the overall economic recovery lost momentum at the end of last year.

title: Job-Hopping CEO Joseph Vittoria Ran Both Hertz and Avis
summary: Executive, who has died at age 85, shuttled between car-rental rivals and later chartered luxury sailing yachts. Joseph Vittoria could be viewed as a classic job-hopper. In his case, however, he kept hopping between the same two rental-car companies, Hertz Corp. and Avis Inc.

title: At Age 115, She Was Content to Look Out Her Window
summary: Iris Westman of North Dakota, who died Jan. 3, had more to say about Warren G. Harding than about Donald Trump.

title: The Reddit GameStop Bubble Is Just a Game-for Now
summary: Online-forum punters have exploited a quirk to push up some unloved stocks. The risk is that investors start believing the share prices imply real-world prospects.. Wall Street can't take its eyes off once-unloved stocks such as GameStop and BlackBerry , which are rocketing due to a kind of betting game played by online forum users. The real risk is that investors start to believe something deeper is going on.

title: In a Waist-Up World, $900 Luxe Sweaters Are Zoom Status Symbols
summary: For formerly niche knitwear brands, sweater sales are way up. Waist-up dressing has given rise (or re-rise) to formerly outré sweater trends like technicolor knits.. On the night in November when Taylor Swift broke her own record for career American Music Awards, she was not wearing a custom-made gold-sequined bodysuit and gold-and-pink floor-length cape nor a metallic Balmain mini-dress with matching thigh-high boots, as she has for the ceremony in the past. While video-ing in her thanks for Artist of the Year, the "Cardigan" singer was wearing a sweater. A black, cotton-blend, rib-knit, mock-turtleneck sweater, more preschool teacher than pop star. Her fellow singer Harry Styles went viral on TikTok this summer when he appeared in a Technicolor dreamcoat of a cardigan from JW Anderson, prompting the designer, Jonathan Anderson, to share the design with fans.

summary: A volley of major earnings reports are due including big tech names like Tesla and Apple. Here's what we're watching ahead of Wednesday's opening bell.

summary: Short sellers are thick-skinned, but the nasty comments, insults and threats leveled at them feel like political fights, not investing differences. Andrew Left is no stranger to conflict when it comes to investing. He makes a living betting that companies will stumble, and he calls out executives by name.

title: The Best and Worst U.S. Airlines of 2020
summary: The pandemic made flying tougher on all carriers, but the ones that handled the challenges best tended to be the ones that had outperformed rivals in previous years. Airline customers didn't do much flying last year, but they sure had plenty to complain about.

title: At a Retirement Home, Covid-19 Vaccines Mean an End to Isolation
summary: Resume Subscription. PORTOLA VALLEY, Calif.-Minutes after getting his first dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, Stanton Goldstein had one hope in mind: visiting his dementia-addled wife who has been isolated for months in the same retirement community.

title: Aging in Quarantine? It's Been Fast and Furious
summary: Our skin has become a road map of the past year's lows.. I feel like I've aged six years in six months. These days, it's a statement often repeated among friends and heard by dermatologists. Can we chalk it up to quarantine exhaustion, or has lockdown actually done something to speed up the aging process on our skin? "I'm hearing more complaints about accelerated aging in my practice than ever before," says Whitney Bowe, a New York City-based dermatologist and author of The Beauty of Dirty Skin. "It's very similar to what I used to see when there was a death in the family or a divorce and patients would come in and say, 'I feel like I aged five years overnight.' Now we're seeing that with Covid."

title: Africa, Without Vaccines, Grapples With Deadlier Covid Surge
summary: Resume Subscription. JOHANNESBURG-In Nigeria's largest city, some public hospitals have run out of oxygen amid a coronavirus resurgence, forcing doctors to make life-or-death decisions. In Zimbabwe's capital, scores of public-sector health-care workers are falling ill. In the Democratic Republic of Congo, power outages are hobbling the treatment of record numbers of Covid-19 patients in some hospitals.

title: Covid-19 Complacency Poses Potential Risk to Global Financial Stability, IMF Warns
summary: Investor expectations for recovery, government support have fueled asset prices, raising concerns about excessive risk-taking. WASHINGTON-Expectations for an economic recovery and continued government aid are fueling overconfidence among investors, the International Monetary Fund said Wednesday, raising the risk of a sudden drop in asset prices that could threaten financial stability.

title: Ant Plans Major Revamp in Response to Chinese Pressure
summary: Fintech giant plans to become a financial holding company overseen by China's central bank. Ant Group Co. is planning to turn itself into a financial holding company overseen by China's central bank, responding to pressure to fall fully in line with financial regulations, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Job Growth in the South Bucks Losses in Rest of U.S.

summary: With sixth sortie since November by heavy bomber, U.S. aims to brush back Tehran while Biden settles Iran policy.

summary: Brewer to be the only Black woman leading a Fortune 500 company. Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. named Starbucks Corp. operating chief Rosalind Brewer as its next chief executive, setting her up to be the only Black woman leading a Fortune 500 company today.

title: Ahead of Riot, Capitol Police Knew of Potential for Violence, Official Says
summary: Acting police chief says department's board turned down a request for National Guard support two days before the attack. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Capitol Police knew before the Jan. 6 rally by supporters of former President Donald Trump that the event could turn violent, but the department didn't sufficiently prepare, the acting police chief said Tuesday.

title: No Impeachment Surprise
summary: Republicans signal why most will vote against convicting Trump.. Forty-five Senate Republicans voted Tuesday to support a motion saying an impeachment trial of a former President is unconstitutional, and the media are professing shock. Haven't they been paying attention? GOP opposition to trying a former President who is now a private citizen has been building since Inauguration Day, and based on current impeachment evidence the vote suggests the trial will end in Senate acquittal.

title: Biden's 100-Day Pause on Deportations Blocked by Texas Judge
summary: Pause announced on the president's first day in office; judge says it violated Administrative Procedure Act. WASHINGTON-A federal judge in Texas temporarily blocked the Biden administration's 100-day pause on deportations, saying it likely violated the executive branch's legal obligations for immigration enforcement.

title: Most GOP Senators Vote Against Holding Impeachment Trial
summary: Senate votes 55-45 to block motion from Rand Paul, but tally indicates little support among GOP for conviction. WASHINGTON-Most Republican senators questioned the Senate's authority to hold an impeachment trial for a former president, dealing a blow to Democrats' chances of convicting Donald Trump of inciting an attack on the Capitol.

title: Wisconsin Pharmacist to Plead Guilty to Attempting to Spoil Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: Two federal charges of attempting to tamper with consumer products carry up to 10 years in prison each. A Wisconsin pharmacist agreed to plead guilty to intentionally attempting to spoil hundreds of doses of Covid-19 vaccine by leaving them unrefrigerated on two nights late last year at the hospital where he worked, according to a plea agreement filed in federal court.

title: Allstate to Sell Life Insurance Unit to Blackstone for $2.8 Billion
summary: Allstate Life Insurance Co. holds about 80%, or $23 billion, of Allstate's life and annuity reserves. Private equity giant Blackstone Group Inc. has agreed to buy Allstate Life Insurance Co. from Allstate Corp. for $2.8 billion, the latest in a slew of deals between financial firms and life insurance businesses.

title: Biden Has First Call With Russian President Vladimir Putin
summary: President reaffirmed support for Ukraine's sovereignty; voiced concern over SolarWinds hack, bounties on U.S. troops and jailing of Navalny. WASHINGTON-The White House said Tuesday that President Biden held his first call as president with Russian President Vladimir Putin and raised concerns about issues including the detaining of opposition leader Alexei Navalny, the massive SolarWinds hack and reports of Russia offering bounties on U.S. troops.

title: Microsoft Masters the Cloud
summary: Software titan's cloud growth and profit margins accelerate despite intense competition. Microsoft didn't rebuild its business around a possible global crisis, but the nature and timing of the pandemic certainly played to its strengths.

title: Goldman CEO David Solomon Takes $10 Million Pay Cut for 1MDB Scandal
summary: The bank had said it would claw back or withhold $174 million in compensation from current, former executives. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. slashed Chief Executive David Solomon's 2020 pay by 36%, punishment for the bank's admission last year that it broke U.S. laws in its dealings with an investment fund at the heart of a global corruption ring.
